high bp.name: Lose extra pounds and watch your waistline. Blood pressure often increases as weight increases.
Monitor your blood pressure at home and get regular checkups.

low bp.name: Increase fluid intake: Drinking plenty of fluids can help raise blood pressure.

diabetes.name: Keep your blood pressure and cholesterol under control

diarrhoea.name: Never eat raw and uncooked food

vomiting.name: Avoid caffeine, alcohol and carbonated drinks
Avoid food that could trigger nausea and vomiting
Avoid greasy and processed foods, and foods that contain a lot of salt

fever.name: Never use rubbing alcohol or cold baths to bring the fever down.
Offer plenty of liquids to avoid dehydration.
Remember to drink lots of fluids.

cough and cold.name: Avoiding close contact with sick people
Avoiding touching one’s eyes, nose or mouth
Early self-isolation of those feeling unwell, feverish and having other symptoms of influenza
Good respiratory hygiene – covering mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing, using tissues and disposing of them correctly
Regular hand washing with proper drying of the hands
